input_data.title: Coyote
input_data.overview: The story of Ben Clemens, who after 32 years as a border patrol agent is forced to work for the very people he spent his career trying to keep out of the United States. Now exposed to life on the other side of the wall, Ben will start to question his black and white views of the world, challenging his ideology and his loyalties.

response.analytical_summary: Coyote is a dramatic crime series exploring the complexities of the US-Mexico border and the moral compromises individuals make within a flawed system. The story follows a long-serving border patrol agent forced to collaborate with the very people he once opposed, leading him to question his beliefs and loyalties. The series blends elements of crime procedural and political thriller, offering a nuanced perspective on immigration, law enforcement, and the human cost of border security. It promises a character-driven narrative with a focus on moral ambiguity and the erosion of ideological certainty.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: The series begins with Ben Clemens, a dedicated border patrol agent of 32 years, facing unexpected circumstances. A series of events, involving his son, forces him to accept a deal: he must work with a Mexican drug cartel to protect his family. This arrangement thrusts Ben into a world he previously sought to keep at bay, exposing him to the realities of life on the other side of the border. As he navigates this new role, he begins to question his long-held beliefs about law enforcement and the effectiveness of border security measures. He encounters individuals whose stories challenge his black-and-white worldview, forcing him to confront the human cost of his actions and the systemic issues that drive the flow of people across the border. The series follows Ben's journey as he grapples with his conscience, attempts to reconcile his past with his present, and ultimately confronts the consequences of his choices, all while trying to safeguard his familyâ€™s well-being. The narrative explores the blurred lines between right and wrong, and the sacrifices individuals make in the name of survival and loyalty.
response.keyword_sentence: Coyote is a gritty crime drama set against the backdrop of the US-Mexico border, exploring themes of loyalty and moral ambiguity as a dedicated border patrol agent is forced into a dangerous undercover operation, challenging his beliefs and forcing him to confront the complexities of justice and corruption.
